definition: vocal accompaniment in some traditional Chinese operas/to speak in support of/to chime in
old variant of 幫|帮[bang1]
to help/to assist/to support/for sb (i.e. as a help)/hired (as worker)/side (of pail, boat etc)/outer layer/upper (of a shoe)/group/gang/clique/party/secret society
old variant of 幫|帮[bang1]
cavity of body/barrel (e.g. engine cylinder)/compartment/tune/accent of speech

sentences.english: Some government officials speuak in favour of the company that destroyed the earth.
sentences.chinese: 有些政府官员为那家破坏地球的公司帮腔。

sentences.english: When he saw nobody supporting him, he no longer insisted.
sentences.chinese: 他看见没有人帮腔，也就不再坚持了。

sentences.english: Finally, the other girl chimed in. “Four dollars, ” she said.
sentences.chinese: 最后，其他女孩帮腔英寸“四美元，”她说。

sentences.english: Finally, the other girl chimed in. "Four dollars, " she said.
sentences.chinese: 最后，其他女孩帮腔英寸“四美元，”她说。

definition: to agree/to go along with/to echo (what sb says)
to parrot other people's words (idiom); to chime in with others
to help to resolve a dispute/to smooth things over
to comply in order to please others/to accommodate sb else's taste/to make fun of
to interrupt (sb speaking)/interruption/digression
to interrupt (sb talking)/to butt in/to cut into a conversation
to heckle/rowdy jeering/to create a disturbance
to answer/to respond/to converse
to mediate/to broker a compromise
to smile apologetically or obsequiously
to echo one another (idiom)
to speak/words
to answer back sarcastically (idiom)/to retort
to shout/to bellow one's grievances
to give sb a meaningful look
to complain of an injustice/to lament sb's misfortune
